page.title: 10Bonchurch Old Church
page.content: Bonchurch Church was in the last Domesday book 900 years ago. There was traces of the Medieval wall painting in the church. It was uncovered in 1847 the Altar Cross is 17th century Flemish and carved in black oak. It was brought from an abbey in Normandy by Mr Surman in 1820. Charles I came to attend a funeral here. Some people who come to visit the church are holiday makers, school parties,and villagers. The windows are 13th and 15th century. The youngest person buried in the church was 16 years old.There are 115 graves in the grave-yard.The church is 14.78m in length and 3.66m wide. There are only services in June, July and August.The church and the grave-yard is only half an acre of land.The altar rails were made from ancient timbers from the roof.
